newsitem.title: USA: Dow pulls off lows, Nasdaq modestly higher late.
newsitem.headline: Dow pulls off lows, Nasdaq modestly higher late.

text.p: The Dow industrials cut stiff losses in late trading, aided by a rebound in the high-technology sector that lifted the Nasdaq Composite into positive territory.

"It seems we have a bit of a rally here. A lot of the bigger cap techs were up all day and now we have Nasdaq on the plus side. Techs seem to be the backbone of this little intraday rally," said Douglas Myers, a trader at Interstate/Johnson Lane.
The Dow lost 34 to 6027, off a session-low of 5992.86.
The Nasdaq Composite rose two to 1222, off a day low 1194.
Among technology shares trading near session highs, IBM rose one to 128, Intel rose 2-1/2 to 108, Cisco Systems inched up 1/8 to 61-3/8, and Microsoft was up 1-1/8 to 133-5/8.
Stocks were supported by a firmer bond market, with the long bond up 6/32 to yield 6.84 percent.
Losers led gainers 13-9 on NYSE volume of 345 million shares.
